intro: Anacyclus monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in a single, showy head, which is typical for the genus Anacyclus. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
